block.p: Sarah Jenks Boocock, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roger B. Boocock of Barnstable, Mass., was married there on Friday to Mark Wesley Beyreis, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lee A. Beyreis of Kansas City, Kan. The Rev. E. Tucker Bowerfind performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Beyreis, 36, teaches English and is a college adviser at the Pingry School in Martinsville, N.J. She graduated from Yale, from which she also received a master's degree in American studies. She also holds a master's degree in English from Middlebury College. Her father retired as the headmaster of the Riverdale Country School in the Bronx and was later the interim headmaster of the Dalton School in Manhattan.

Sarah Jenks Boocock, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roger B. Boocock of Barnstable, Mass., was married there on Friday to Mark Wesley Beyreis, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lee A. Beyreis of Kansas City, Kan. The Rev. E. Tucker Bowerfind performed the ceremony at St. Mary's Episcopal Church.

Mrs. Beyreis, 36, teaches English and is a college adviser at the Pingry School in Martinsville, N.J. She graduated from Yale, from which she also received a master's degree in American studies. She also holds a master's degree in English from Middlebury College. Her father retired as the headmaster of the Riverdale Country School in the Bronx and was later the interim headmaster of the Dalton School in Manhattan.

Mr. Beyreis, 34, is a senior marketing manager at Merck-Medco Managed Care in Franklin Lakes, N.J., a unit of Merck & Company. A graduate of Stanford University, he received a master's degree in English from the University of Kansas and an M.B.A. from Seton Hall. His father retired as an inspection superintendent at the General Motors Corporation's Fairfax assembly plant in Kansas City.
